meanings.definition: Younger in age or lower in rank.
meanings.sent1: The junior students were excited for the field trip.
meanings.sent2: She is the junior member of the team.
meanings.sent3: The junior puppy tried to keep up with the older dogs.
meanings.sent4: In the junior race, the young athletes showed great potential.
meanings.sent5: The junior princess was next in line for the throne.

meanings.definition: A student in the third year of high school or college.
meanings.sent1: My sister is a junior in high school this year.
meanings.sent2: The juniors organized the school dance.
meanings.sent3: The junior was thrilled to finally be an upperclassman.
meanings.sent4: As a junior, he started thinking about college applications.
meanings.sent5: The junior class planned a charity fundraiser.

meanings.definition: A person of lesser experience or authority.
meanings.sent1: The junior on the team was eager to learn from the seniors.
meanings.sent2: She was promoted to a junior manager position.
meanings.sent3: The junior chef accidentally added too much salt to the dish.
meanings.sent4: As a junior in the company, he had to prove his skills.
meanings.sent5: The junior officer followed the lead of the seasoned captain.
